#Range Mapping Functions in BerkeleyMapper

= Range Mapping functions in BerkeleyMapper =

BerkeleyMapper 2.0 serves KML files based on spatial layers from IUCN for amphibians, birds, and mammals. 

= Details =

(NOTE! for all of the following examples, use http://bnhmmapstest.berkeley.edu/ instead of http://berkeleymapper.berkeley.edu/ until v2 BM goes live.  This is expected to happen sometime in April or May, 2012.

*Amphibian Example*

http://berkeleymapper.berkeley.edu/v2/speciesrange/Plethodon+montanus/binomial/gaa_2011

*Mammal Example*

http://berkeleymapper.berkeley.edu/v2/speciesrange/Lynx+rufus/sci_name/mamm_2009

*Birds Example*

http://berkeleymapper.berkeley.edu/v2/speciesrange/Aburria+aburri/sci_name/birds_2009

An example of inserting calls to these services in the BerkeleyMapper configuration file:
<code language="xml">
<gisdata>
<layer title="IUCN Plethodon montanus Distribution" legend="1" active="1" url="http://www.iucnredlist.org/apps/redlist/details/54596/0">

<![CDATA[http://berkeleymapper.berkeley.edu/v2/speciesrange/Plethodon+montanus/binomial/gaa_2011
]]>
</layer>
</gisdata>
</code>
